bibl.title: Report from Walter Reed to the Adjutant General, June 30, 1900

div1.p: Reed details his duties for the month of June 1900. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Report from Walter Reed to the Adjutant General, June 30, 1900
div1.opener:
Camp Columbia.
Quemados. Cuba.
June 30" 1900.
To the
Adjutant General. U.S. Army.
Washington. D.C.
Sir:
div1.p:
I have the honor to report myself on duty during the month of June
1900. as follows; as Curator Army Medical Museum from June 1" to 18";
en route from Washington. D.C. to Havana. Cuba. per par 32 and 33, S.O. 122.
A.G.O. Washington. May 24" 1900. from June 19" to 25" and from June 26" to
30" on duty at Camp Columbia, Quemados, Cuba as President of Board of officers
investigating the causation of infectious diseases on the island of Cuba.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully,
Your obedient servant. Walter Reed, Major and Surgeon. U.S. Army.
